title: Animals
description: Learn common animal names in Dzardzongke

cards.notes:
White dog

kyi = dog
karu = white (color)
cik = a/an (indefinite article)

Word order in Dzardzongke: noun + adjective + article

Two yellow frogs

balwa = frog
seru = yellow (color)
ny칤 = two (number)

Word order in Dzardzongke: noun + adjective + number

Three black birds

khorak = bird
nakpu = black (color)
sum = three (number)

Note: Another word for bird is 'ja', which is used for white birds.

Four green turtles

ruebal = turtle
jongkhu = green (color)
zhi = four (number)

Word order in Dzardzongke: noun + adjective + number

Five brown monkeys

trip = monkey
m칰kpu = brown (color)
ng치 = five (number)

Word order in Dzardzongke: noun + adjective + number

Six black foxes

aze = fox
kalak = type/kind
nakpu = black (color)
druk = six (number)

Word order in Dzardzongke: noun + type + adjective + number

Seven white birds

ja = bird (specifically used for white birds)
junga = white (color)
duen = seven (number)

Note: 'khorak' is another word for bird, used for black birds.

Eight blue fish

ny치 = fish
ng칩enpo = blue (color)

Word order in Dzardzongke: noun + adjective + number

Nine red butterflies

phempalak = butterfly
che = red (color)

Word order in Dzardzongke: noun + adjective + number

Ten white bats

phawang = bat
thaldok = white (another word for white, different from karu/junga)

Note: Dzardzongke has different words for white: karu, junga, and thaldok.

Congratulations on learning all the animal names in Dzardzongke!

You've learned:
- Animal names: kyi (dog), balwa (frog), khorak/ja (bird), ruebal (turtle), trip (monkey), aze (fox), ny치 (fish), phempalak (butterfly), phawang (bat)
- Colors: karu/junga/thaldok (white), seru (yellow), nakpu (black), jongkhu (green), m칰kpu (brown), ng칩enpo (blue), che (red)
- Numbers: cik (one), ny칤 (two), sum (three), zhi (four), ng치 (five), druk (six), duen (seven), gye (eight), gu (nine), cu (ten)
